com.github.dandelion.core.web.handler

Class AbstractHandlerChain

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dandelion.core.web.handler.AbstractHandlerChain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HandlerChain, Comparable<HandlerChain>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AssetInjectionPostHandler, CacheHeaderPostHandler, ClearCachePreHandler, ClearStoragePreHandler, DebuggerPostHandler, ETagPostHandler, GzipCompressionPostHandler, ProcessJsPostHandler, ReloadBundlePreHandler, ReportAlertPostHandler, SaveRequestPostHandler

    public abstract class AbstractHandlerChain
extends Object
implements HandlerChain

    Abstract base class for handlers.

    Consider extending this class if you wish to insert a custom handler into the chain.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Thibault Duchateau

      • doHandle

        public final void doHandle(HandlerContext context)
        Description copied from interface: HandlerChain

        Start point of the chain. Handlers are executed depending on the HandlerChain.isApplicable(HandlerContext) method and can decide whether the next handler can be executed or not.

        Specified by:
        doHandle in interface HandlerChain
        Parameters:
        context - The context in which the handler is executed.

      • getLogger

        protected abstract org.slf4j.Logger getLogger()
        Returns:
        the actual logger of the handler.

      • handle

        protected abstract boolean handle(HandlerContext context)
        Called by start().
        Parameters:
        request - the request parameter
        Returns:
        a boolean that indicates whether the handler chain should continue handling request or not.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(HandlerChain o)

        Compare (and therefore order) handlers according to their rank.

        Warning: this implementation of compareTo breaks (o1.compareTo(o2) == 0) == (o1.equals(o2)), as two different handlers can have the same precedence.

        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable<HandlerChain>
        Parameters:
        o - the object to compare to.
        Returns:
        the comparison result.
